main event: A civilian airliner spotted a fast-moving object with a fluorescent trail over California in 1954.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 1,500+ mph.
The object left a long fluorescence trail and was observed to be traveling north.
The object was reported by the civilian airliner crew as a 'flying object' at an estimated altitude of 23,000 to 30,000 feet.
The object was observed for an unspecified duration.
The report concluded that the object was an astronomical event, likely a meteor.
location: 20 miles SW of Los Angeles, California
